page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Most of the male working population in the Orton area is concerned with farming. There are 28 men who work on the farms in the area doing the various seasonal jobs associated with sheep and cattle management. There are 13 men working in the building trade _ some in the village and some travelling outside the area. There are two joiners, two roofers and a blacksmith. Six people find employment at the nearby Tebay West Motorway Service Area. There are four wagon drivers and eight people travel to Kendal(15miles) to work in offices. Professional workers include the Vicar,the Doctor,a solicitor,an estate agent,and two school teachers. Most of the females in the area are housewives,helping on the farm or looking after young children.
